word: Principle of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
definition: A fundamental principle in civil law requiring parties to exercise their rights and perform their obligations in good faith and with integrity, aiming to preserve the trust established between them.
japaneseDefinition: 権利の行使及び義務の履行は、信義を重んじ、誠実に行わなければならないという民法の基本原則。
japaneseWordTranslation: 信義誠実の原則 (しんぎせいじつのげんそく)
legalContext: Civil Code Art. 1, Para. 2: “The exercise of rights and performance of duties must be conducted in good faith.”
japaneseLegalContext: 民法第1条第2項: 権利の行使及び義務の履行は、信義を重んじ、誠実に行わなければならない。
exampleSentence: The court applied the Principle of Good Faith and Fair Dealing to prevent the obligee from exercising a highly inequitable termination right.
exampleTranslation: 裁判所は、債権者が著しく不公平な解除権を行使するのを阻止するため、信義誠実の原則を適用した。
